Barnet is located approximately 11 miles North West of Central London, and is directly connected via the Northern Line at High Barnet Station. Spires is situated right at the heart of Barnet, with a core catchment of 111,000. Retailers on the adjacent High Street include Gails, Caffe Nero, Five Guys and Holland and Barrett. The Spires Shopping Centre is Barnet and its surrounding's main retail destination. Anchor tenants include H&M, JD Sports and Waitrose. The centre is also supported by a multi-storey car park, and can be accessed directly from the High Street.

detailedDescription: Investment Summary • Bedford is an afﬂuent historic market town located approximately 50 miles (80km) north of London. • Universal Studios has acquired c.500 acres of land three miles south of Bedford for a new theme park, set to attract 8.5 million visitors annually. • The average household income in Bedford rose by 11.5% year-on-year in 2024 (ONS). • Bedford has secured £22.6 million through the government’s Towns Fund, with a signiﬁcant share directed towards the regeneration of Midland Road. • The property beneﬁts from dual frontage, occupying a prominent position on Midland Road, and into the mall within The Harpur Centre. • The property is fully let to New Look Retailers Limited until July 2029. • Total base rent of £80,000 for the current lease year. • Freehold. We are instructed to seek offers in excess of £755,000 (Seven Hundred and Fifty Five Thousand Pounds), subject to contract and exclusive of VAT. A purchase at this level based on the base rent reﬂects a net initial yield of 10% and a low capital value of £30 psf , assuming standard purchaser’s costs.

This location benefits from a significant footfall from the daytime office population and a nearby residential population that has increased significantly in recent years, with various large student and private residential developments on Nelson Street and Rupert Street. An efficient, well configured unit in a busy position on the western side of Broadmead in Bristol city centre. Surrounding occupiers include Poundland, Pure Gym, Costa, Tesco Metro, a Lidl supermarket, Pret and Primark.

This location benefits from a significant footfall from the daytime office population and a nearby residential population that has increased significantly in recent years, with various large student and private residential developments on Nelson Street and Rupert Street. A busy corner location within Bristol city centre, on the western side of Broadmead. Surrounding occupiers include Poundland, Pure Gym, Costa, Tesco Metro, a Lidl supermarket, Pret and Primark.

• Bromley is the largest town in southeast London and is a popular London commuter town. • The London Borough of Bromley is one of the largest economies in Greater London with an extensive consumer base of 630,000 people. • The property is situated on the eastern side of High Street, within the towns 100% retailing pitch. • The subject property is adjacent to a full range Marks & Spencer, who have been in occupation since 1931. • Let to Moss Bros Group Limited for a term of five years from 13th April 2024, at a current rental of £110,000 per annum. • The tenant has been in occupation for over 10 years. • Freehold. We are instructed to seek offers in excess of £1,300,000 (One Million Three Hundred Thousand Pounds) subject to contract and exclusive of VAT. Allowing for purchaser’s costs of 5.99%, a purchase at this price reflects a net initial yield of 8% . A purchase of the SPV which the subject property is held in may be considered by the vendor. Further information is available upon request.

The world famous city of Cambridge is rich in history and boasts one of the most vibrant economies in the UK. The city is renowned for having one of the world’s leading institutions for education. The city is also Britain’s pre-eminent research and development centre and is widely recognised as one of the world’s leading high technology business clusters. The dynamic and charismatic city of Cambridge is the administrative centre for the county and is located approximately 65 miles north of London, 58 miles south west of Norwich and 43 miles south east of Peterborough. The Grafton Centre currently provides just under 500,000 sq ft of retail and leisure space. The centre, together with Fitzroy and Burleigh Street, create their own retail pitch, which is conveniently accessed via car or public transport and benefits from the presence of Primark. The Centre further benefits from its proximity to Anglia Ruskin University. The centre is currently in a transitional period as planning has been approved to convert the vast majority of the centre into Life Sciences. A smaller element of retail will remain as part of this exciting period of time for The Grafton.

The world famous city of Cambridge is rich in history and boasts one of the most vibrant economies in the UK. The city is renowned for having one of the world’s leading institutions for education. The city is also Britain’s pre-eminent research and development centre and is widely recognised as one of the world’s leading high technology business clusters. The re-established historic street of Christ's Lane provides the key pedestrian route between the Grafton Centre, Christ's Pieces, the bus station and the prime retail core of Cambridge. With frontage on to St Andrews Street, Christ’s Lane is opposite entrances to Lion Yard and the Grand Arcade scheme. Christ's Lane is a distinctive retail-led, mixed-use scheme, situated in the high-profile conservation area between the two historic colleges of Christ's and Emmanuel. The scheme provides 8 retail units, 1 catering unit and 15 luxury apartments. Current occupiers include Zara, H&M, Metro Bank, Starbucks, Tesco Express and Heavenly Desserts.

• Cambridge is an exceptionally attractive and cathedral city and one of the UK’s premier retailing destinations. • The city has a large and exceptionally affluent primary catchment population of 627,000 people, ranking the city 22nd of the 200 PROMIS retail centres in the UK. • Cambridge enjoys 8.1 million visitors per annum, contributing more than £800m to the city’s local economy. • 100% prime retail investment on the eastern side of Market Hill, within the heart of Cambridge’s historic retail core. • The property is let entirely to Lululemon Athletica UK Ltd on a full repairing and insuring lease, expiring 19th August 2031 (TBO 19th August 2026), at a rental of £150,000 per annum. • Freehold.

• Cambridge is an exceptionally attractive cathedral city and one of the UK’s premier retailing destinations. • The city has a large and exceptionally affluent primary catchment population of 627,000 people, ranking the city 22nd of the 200 PROMIS retail centres in the UK. • Cambridge enjoys 8.1 million visitors per annum, contributing more than £800m to the city’s local economy. • 100% prime retail investment on the northern side of Petty Cury, in the heart of Cambridge’s historic retail core. • The property is let entirely to the undoubted covenant of Nationwide Building Society, on a full repairing and insuring lease until 16th October 2033, providing an approximate unexpired term of 8.40 years. • Total current income: £440,000 per annum. • Freehold.

• The historic cathedral city of Canterbury is an attractive retail centre with a highly affluent catchment population. • Canterbury occupies a central role in Kent’s tourism offering as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and in 2023 its Cathedral was ranked the most visited attraction in Kent. • The property occupies a highly prominent position on the northern side of the pedestrianised St George’s Street, directly opposite the 116,000 sq ft Fenwick department store. • The property is let entirely to the undoubted covenant of Mountain Warehouse Limited on a brand-new 11-year lease. • Long leasehold with approximately 124 years unexpired. • Total net income £249,530 per annum.

Chesham is a charming market town in the Chiltern Hills, popular with London commuters and located approximately 30 miles northwest of central London. The property is positioned on the eastern side of High Street, just a 1-minute walk from Chesham Underground Station, serviced by the Metropolitan Line. Nearby national occupiers include Waterstones, Boots, Millets, and Costa

2 Ruskin Square sits directly next to East Croydon Station, connecting the development to Central London destinations including London Victoria and Clapham Junction, as well as serving as a direct line to London Gatwick Aiport. As well as Amazon Fresh and a Yoga Studio, 2 Ruskin Square benefits to being in close proximity to Boxpark Croydon - a popular street food vendor with high quality F&B options. This new retail opportunity sits at the ground floor state of the art office block, which had been confirmed to be fully occupied by the GPA in May 2023. HMRC have also taken all the office floor space in the adjacent block, 1 Ruskin Square, which also has an Amazon Fresh and Yoga Studio open and trading.

displayAddress: Princes Mead Shopping Centre, Farnborough, Hampshire, GU14 6YA
detailedDescription: Farnborough is a well-established commuter town located in north-east Hampshire. Princes Mead Shopping Centre sits at the heart of Farnborough town centre, approximately 34 miles south-west of London and 16 miles east of Basingstoke. Princes Mead benefits from a highly affluent and densely populated catchment, with approximately 239,000 people living within a 15-minute drive time. INVESTMENT SUMMARY • Highbridge is a coastal town in the county of Somerset, located approximately 10 miles (16km) south of Weston-super-Mare and 35 miles (40km) southwest of Bristol. • The subject property is located just 7 miles (11km) east of Hinkley Point C, one of Europe’s largest infrastructure projects, and 6 miles (9.6 km) from The Gravity Smart Campus, a £4 billion gigafactory set to generate 4,000 high value jobs. • The subject property is situated on the southern side of Market Street. • The ground floor is let to One Stop Stores Limited at a rental of £35,000 per annum for a term of 15 years, with a 10 year break option. • The upper parts comprise six residential flats benefiting from vacant possession with an ERV of £67,067. • The total potential income is £102,067 per annum. • Freehold.

Huntingdon is a rapidly expanding Cambridgeshire town located approximately 18 miles northwest of Cambridge and 19 miles south of Peterborough. The town benefits from great transport links as it sits on the intersection of the A14 and the A1 with direct access to the A10, M11 and M1. Huntingdon has a 1-hour train to London Kings Cross with 2-3 services typically running per hour. Chequers Shopping Centre provides the retail gateway between the traditional High Street in Huntingdon, and St Germain Walk. Chequers Shopping Centre is fully pedestrianised. It was extended in partnership with Huntingdon District Council to create an exciting new retail space with large contemporary units. This development facilitated lettings to M&S Food, Next and TK Maxx and a parade of 6 smaller units, parallel to St Germain Walk. The new anchor stores were all major new additions to the town and ensured a wider catchment was pulled into the town centre.

Huntingdon is a rapidly expanding Cambridgeshire town located approximately 18 miles northwest of Cambridge and 19 miles south of Peterborough. The town benefits from great transport links as it sits on the intersection of the A14 and the A1 with direct access to the A10, M11 and M1. Huntingdon has a 1-hour train to London Kings Cross with 2-3 services typically running per hour. St Germain Walk provides an extension to the Chequers Court scheme and links the retail offer from the traditional High Street and Chequers Court to the Sainsbury’s food store and the dominant town centre car parking provision at the rear of the site. Unit 5 & 6 is available to let.

Exchange Ilford comprises most of Ilford Town Centre in the East London Borough of Redbridge. It provides a key pedestrian link from Ilford Station which benefits from National Rail and Elizabeth Lines to the high street. Exchange Ilford is the dominant urban centre sitting at the heart of the town’s lively and culturally diverse shopping district. The scheme benefits from the new entrance to Ilford Station directly opposite, connecting Ilford into the heart of London via the Elizabeth Line. The scheme is anchored by M&S and offers strong brands such as H&M, TK Maxx, Next and had a recent opening of Jamaica Blue. TK Maxx will relocate in 2023 to a new store. The centre provides a large proportion of Ilford’s car parking with 1,600 spaces and the scheme currently boasts an average weekly footfall of 205,000 which is set to increase with the recent opening of the Crossrail Station entrance opposite the centre. Further to this, Ilford Town Centre is the focus of a major regeneration programme which is on track to deliver 6,000 new homes and 3,000 new jobs as well as investment in the public realm by 2030.

The scheme is anchored by Waitrose with other key tenants including Next, Superdrug, Just for Pets, TG Jones, Waterstones, Costa and Charles Clinkard, and also hosts a strong range of local independent retailers including Lynwood & Co. The scheme also benefits from a free 800-space shoppers car park. The premises are arranged over ground and first floors.
